conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 33 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<PROPOSALS COUNT> [add here (inclusive of current)] </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 1 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 33 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As it cost me 33 ZUP to produce the resource, I want to at least break even, but I also need to consider making a profit. I would like to start the negotiation by setting a price higher than my cost to leave room for negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I have a quality resource available that I believe will be quite valuable to you. Considering the costs I've incurred and the value it provides, I think a fair starting point for our negotiation is 40 ZUP for my resource. Let's discuss and find an agreement that works for both of us. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for the offer. I'm interested in acquiring the resource you have. I believe a slightly better deal for both of us, considering market rates and the value of the resource, would be 35 ZUP. Let's see if we can come to an agreement on this. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 35 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 2 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 33 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> The other player has made a counteroffer of 35 ZUP, which is above my production cost but below my initial asking price. I'm willing to negotiate and come down slightly from my original proposal to find a middle ground that is profitable for me and acceptable for the other player. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 38 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I appreciate your counteroffer and understand the need for a fair deal. Considering the production cost and the quality of the resource, I believe a reasonable compromise would be 38 ZUP. This ensures I am able to cover my costs and also make a modest profit, while you acquire the resource at a competitive price. </message>

<other player message> I see your point and I want to make sure that you also benefit from this deal. How about we meet halfway from my last offer and settle on 36 ZUP? This price should allow you to cover your costs, earn a profit, and also provide me with the resource at a fair price. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 36 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 3 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 33 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> The other player has made a reasonable offer that covers my production cost and offers a small profit. It's close to the compromise I suggested, and it's important to maintain good relations for potential future transactions. I am inclined to accept this offer to ensure a successful and amicable deal. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> I believe this is a fair compromise that benefits us both. I'm happy to accept the offer of 36 ZUP for the resource. Looking forward to finalizing this deal and potentially working together in the future. </message>
